page.title: 08 Life in Grafton Underwood
page.content: cont'd One resident in Grafton Underwood is Mr C. Oglethorpe who until July 1985 was the head teacher of Millbrook Junior School in Kettering. He lives in School House on the west side of the village street. He has lived there since 1970 and has seen town people move into the village and village people move out. On Saturdays when he is not at school he rises at 07.30 and at 08.30 he watches the cows go by on their way to be milked. In Summer he plays tennis on his friends court from 10.00 until 12.00 and then eats. He may spend his afternoon gardening and from 22.00 may visit the 'Samuel Pepys' pub in Slipton. He is very happy living in Grafton Underwood and if he didn't live there he would probably like to live in Geddington.
